intro: Marlierea cana, commonly known as the white marlierea, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Marlierea cana is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
